content.title: Second-Look Laparotomy
content.definition: A planned re-exploration of the abdomen 24-48 hours after initial surgery for acute mesenteric ischemia to reassess bowel viability and resect any additional non-viable intestine.

clinical_features.viability_uncertainty: Bowel viability often unclear at initial surgery
clinical_features.delayed_necrosis: Some bowel may progress to necrosis after revascularization

clinical_features.questionable_bowel: Any bowel of uncertain viability left at initial surgery

concepts.definition: How to assess bowel viability at second-look.

clinical_features.clinical: Color, peristalsis, arterial bleeding from cut edge
clinical_features.resection: Resect clearly non-viable bowel, preserve marginal

clinical_features.decision: Decision for second-look made at initial surgery, not delayed
clinical_features.abdomen_management: Often use temporary closure at initial surgery

content.statement: Second-Look Laparotomy is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Mesenteric that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.
